text: hello guys , Is there any possible ways to display external datas as bar graphs , pie charts etc in CRM custom object or maybe using UI extensions ? thanks in advance
Hi Sagar! This is something we've been considering but unfortunately not available yet. Could you tell me more about your use case and what your data source is?

Hi Aanchal , I am trying to integrate solar Inverter  data directly in CRM through API . I’m creating a custom object in CRM and by building up the cards with UI extension I’m showing up the datas . For this , I also need to show the datas in graph for better understanding about solar datas and their historical reports . Is there any way I can show up these datas on CRM ?

Hey team! I have a potential CRM card use case that would involve serverless function, but curious if you guys can shed some light on what/where I should start.

*Use case: an user-editable table with fixed table headers.*
User can add a row and enter input (free text), and can edit existing rows. Ideally user can remove a row but not so important for the first iterations.

Basically like simplified excel sheet. Doesn’t matter for end users where we host the input backend - they don’t need to live in a property etc.
It would be really nice if you could define the margin on the tile component, the current margin is like triple all the other cards. It just makes it look funky.

Hey <@U04GLGWASUS>, I've build one of these cards before the functioned like a seudo excel before, basically I used the table component and in each of the cells I had a text Input component. The table it self can start with a state of [] and you can have a button that will append a blank row to the state whenever you want to add a new row.
you can then have a save button to write out the array to your database or the HubSpot property or object
It will be really nice when we can provide custom actions in the action menu component: <https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/platform/ui-extension-components#action-menu>
Thanks! That’s what I’m thinking. So we’d need two buttons at minimum: Add and Save. Correct? <@U01QVR44MEY> :pray:
Yeah that's the easy way to do it, technically you could auto save with a debounce of the table state change but that's totally up to you
:wave: Hey <@U01QVR44MEY>! What kind of custom actions are you thinking?!
Basically anything and everything would be great to just be able to define an onClick event

That is definitely one we’ve been considering! We are hoping to revisit actions in Q2 to expand our current library of available actions. Let me know if you think of anything else that would be useful!
